#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Cook Dinuguan
#Text=If you 'd like to replicate blood pork stew at home , make classic Filipino dinuguan .
#Text=Keep in mind that you can use any combination of pork belly , shoulder , loin , or intestines .
#Text=Just marinate strips of the pork in fish sauce and sauté them along with onion , garlic , and ginger .
#Text=Stir pig 's blood and vinegar into the mixture .
#Text=Then let the pork stew simmer until it thickens and the meat becomes tender .
#Text=Enjoy dinuguan with rice or steamed rice cakes .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=pork belly
#Text=fish sauce
#Text=2 in ( 5 cm ) piece of fresh ginger root
#Text=pig 's blood
#Text=vinegar , divided
#Text=vegetable oil
#Text=1 onion , chopped
#Text=4 cloves garlic , minced
#Text=water
#Text=1 tablespoon ( 12.5 g ) brown sugar
#Text=2 Anaheim peppers
#Text=Salt and pepper to taste
#Text=pork intestines , cleaned , optional
#Text=Makes 4 to 6 servings
#Text=Steps
#Text=Marinating the Pork
#Text=Cut the pork belly into strips .
#Text=Take out of pork belly and use a sharp knife to slice it into 1/2 in to 1 in ( 1.3 to 2.5 cm ) strips .
#Text=Place the pork into an airtight container .
#Text=If you do n't have pork belly , you can use pork loin or shoulder .
#Text=Pour fish sauce over the pork and chill it for 1 hour .
#Text=Toss the pork with of fish sauce in the airtight container .
#Text=Then cover the container and put it in the refrigerator .
#Text=Marinate the pork for 1 hour .
#Text=Marinating the pork will intensify the flavor of the dinuguan .
#Text=Clean and boil of pork intestines ( optional ) .
#Text=Thoroughly rub and rinse the intestines under running water .
#Text=Then place them in a large pot and pour enough water to cover the intestines .
#Text=Bring the water to boil over high heat and add 1 1/2 in ( 3.8 cm ) of the fresh ginger root .
#Text=Boil the intestines for 45 minutes .
#Text=The intestines should become soft .
#Text=Let them cool before you slice and add them to the dinuguan .
#Text=Ensure that you sanitize your work space after handling the intestines because they contain bacteria that can cause disease .
#Text=Cooking the Pork with Aromatics
#Text=Combine the pig 's blood and of the vinegar .
#Text=Pour of pig 's blood into a bowl and stir in of the vinegar until it 's incorporated .
#Text=Set the blood mixture aside .
#Text=If the blood is coagulated , put it in the blender and pulse the blood until it liquefies .
#Text=Sauté the onion , garlic , and ginger for about 5 minutes .
#Text=Heat of vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat .
#Text=When the oil shimmers , stir in 1 chopped onion , 4 cloves of minced garlic , and 1 teaspoon ( 2 g ) of grated fresh ginger .
#Text=Stir the aromatics occasionally until they soften and become fragrant .
#Text=Add the pork and cook it for 3 to 5 minutes .
#Text=Keep the burner at medium heat and stir in the marinated pork strips .
#Text=If you 're using the intestines , you can also add them .
#Text=Stir and cook the pork until it becomes light brown .
#Text=Stir in the vinegar and boil it for 5 minutes .
#Text=Pour of vinegar into the pot and turn the burner to medium-high .
#Text=Bring the vinegar to a boil and then continue to boil the mixture with the lid off .
#Text=Avoid stirring the dinuguan while it boils .
#Text=About half of the vinegar should evaporate as it boils .
#Text=Simmering and Serving the Dinuguan
#Text=Add the water and simmer the dinuguan for 15 to 20 minutes .
#Text=Pour of water into the pot and bring the mixture to a boil .
#Text=Turn the burner down to medium or medium-low so it bubbles gently .
#Text=Put the lid on the pot and simmer the dinuguan until the pork is tender enough to cut with a fork .
#Text=Stir in the pig 's blood mixture and sugar .
#Text=Add the reserved pig 's blood and vinegar mixture along with 1 tablespoon ( 12.5 g ) of brown sugar .
#Text=Stir until the pig 's blood and sugar have dissolved .
#Text=Keep stirring until you do n't see lumps of blood or sugar .
#Text=Add 2 Anaheim peppers and season the dinuguan to taste .
#Text=Stir in the whole peppers and taste the dinuguan .
#Text=Add salt and pepper according to your taste .
#Text=Simmer the dinuguan for 10 minutes before serving .
#Text=Let the dinuguan bubble gently over medium heat with the lid off .
#Text=The sauce should thicken as it cooks .
#Text=Then turn off the burner and serve the dinuguan with rice or puto ( steamed rice cakes ) .
#Text=Store the leftover dinuguan in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Knife and cutting board
#Text=Airtight container
#Text=Bowl
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Large pot with a lid
#Text=Quick Summary
